articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Dominant 7th in F (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Dominant 7th in F (Shape: C)

An arpeggio is the playing of the individual notes in a chord in a sequential manner. The Dominant 7th arpeggio is a series of notes that consists of the root, major third, perfect fifth, and minor seventh of a dominant 7th chord. In the key of F, the Dominant 7th arpeggio using the C shape starts on the note F.

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- A (Major 3rd)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- E (Minor 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Dominant 7th arpeggio is commonly found in genres such as jazz, blues, funk, and rock. It adds tension and color to chord progressions and is often used in improvisation to create a sense of resolution when played over a dominant 7th chord.

## Songs
1. "All Blues" by Miles Davis
2. "Pride and Joy" by Stevie Ray Vaughan
3. "Cissy Strut" by The Meters
